channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: PayPal and UPS are sparking a late-session rally, powering stocks to fresh records
item.description: S&P added 0.4%, Dow Jones was up 0.6%, and the Nasdaq was 1% higher.

item.title: A federal judge just indefinitely barred the Trump administration from firing federal employees during the government shutdown
item.description: The judge previously issued a temporary restraining order against the job cuts that was set to expire on Wednesday.

item.title: From retail to tech, here are the 10 corporations that recently announced mass layoffs
item.description: Companies are pointing to factors like tariff costs, shifts in consumer spending, and investments in AI that have led them to let go of thousands.

item.title: Memo From Bill Gates Warns Against Climate Alarmism
item.description: In a memo, the Microsoft co-founder warned against climate alarmism and appears to have shifted some of his views about climate change.

item.title: Santa Ana Winds Heighten Fire Risk in Southern California
item.description: Some areas near Los Angeles are under a red flag warning through Wednesday.

item.title: As OpenAI restructures, Microsoft locks in long-term gains
item.description: OpenAI has become a public benefit corporation, giving Microsoft a 27% stake and long-term access to research methods

item.title: Netanyahu Orders Strikes in Gaza, as Israel Says Hamas Violated Cease-Fire
item.description: The office of the Israeli prime minister said Tuesday evening that he had ordered “forceful strikes,” accusing Hamas of firing on Israeli troops and f...

item.title: The U.S. just bet $1 billion that AI supercomputers can turn most cancers from ‘death sentences’ to ‘manageable conditions’ within 8 years
item.description: Chris Wright says the supercomputers will also allow the U.S. to “re-create the center of the sun on Earth” given how they benefit fusion energy resea...

item.title: What Zohran Mamdani Learned as an Africana Studies Major at Bowdoin
item.description: The mayoral candidate has said his education was formative. But critics say that his degree exemplifies how colleges steep students in leftist dogma.

item.title: Explosions Seen Over Gaza Skyline After Netanyahu Orders New Strikes
item.description: There were explosions over the Gaza skyline after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israeli accused Hamas of violating the cease-fire and ordered t...

item.title: U.S. Military Kills 14 More People Accused of Smuggling Drugs on Boats
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said that the three strikes hit four boats in international waters and that there had been one survivor.

item.title: With Baseball, I No Longer Care Who Wins
item.description: Now that I can no longer follow the ball, baseball looks like a dance.

item.title: Live Updates: Hurricane Melissa Roars Across Jamaica, Bringing Wind, Rain and Risk
item.description: The storm’s slow pace prompted warnings about flooding and landslides. Jamaican officials said many residents had refused to evacuate, and one ministe...

item.description: The office of the Israeli prime minister said Tuesday evening that he had ordered “forceful strikes,” accusing Hamas of firing on Israeli troops and f...

item.title: Trump Bonds With Japan’s Leader Over Baseball and U.S. Beef
item.description: The president and Sanae Takaichi, the Japanese prime minister, traded compliments in Tokyo, but signaled no major breakthrough in resolving ongoing tr...
